intro: Phagnalon viridifolium var. omanense, commonly known as the Oman greenleaf phagnalon, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Oman. It belongs to the family Compositae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, adapting to the harsh desert environment. Its leaves are generally narrow and grass-like, with a dark green coloration. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom during the brief rainy season, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
